articles.content:
Floral Baskets to DPRK Missions Abroad 
   Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Political parties, ministries of governments, organizations, organs and political and public figures of different countries sent floral baskets to DPRK missions on the occasion of the 58th birthday of the DPRK.
 Among them are the Commission for External Affairs of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam, the Vietnamese Ministries of Foreign Affairs, National Defence, Public Security, Culture and Information, Agriculture and Rural Development and Commerce, the Vietnam-Korea Friendship Association, the Iranian Ministry of Defence and Armed Forces Logistics, the Iranian Table Tennis Federation, the Central Committee of the People's Party of Cambodia, the Cambodian Ministries of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation, Culture and Fine Arts and Health, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist), the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association, the Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association, the Cuban minister of Foreign Affairs, the president of the Central Committee of the Fatherland Front of Vietnam, the deputy general secretary of the Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party, the Syrian ministers of Foreign Affairs and Information, the Syrian chief of the General Staff of the Army and Armed Forces, the general secretary of the Syrian Arab Socialist Union Party, the chairman of the Proletarian and Islamic Revolutionary Wounded Organization of Iran, the chairwoman of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle, the president of the Cambodian Senate, the general secretary of the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine, the secretary general of the All India Indo-Korean Friendship Association, the joint secretary of the All India Agricultural Workers' Union, the director of the Indian Institute for the Foreign Policy, the president of the Doz Company in the Czech Republic, the chairman of the Global Group of Britain and the secretary general of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea.

Foreign Guests Come to Take Part in Film Festival
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Come to Take Part in Film Festival 
   Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Delegations and delegates of Germany, Sweden, Slovenia, Singapore, Britain, Italy, Japan, China, Hong Kong of China, Cambodia, France and Finland and a delegation of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) arrived here Tuesday by air or train to take part in the 10th Pyongyang International Film Festival.
 Secretary of State of the Ministry of Culture and Fine Arts of Cambodia Khim Sarith and Director of the Goethe Institute of Germany Uwe Schmelter who are guests of honor flew to Pyongyang.    
 Earlier, international jury members of Germany, Russia, Italy and China and delegations and delegates of Laos, Syria and Austria arrived here.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from Mongolian President
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Mongolian President
   Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Mongolian President Nambariin Enkhbayar.
 The gift was handed to an official concerned Tuesday by S. Khurelbaatar, head of the delegation of the Mongolian Foreign Ministry, on a visit to the DPRK.

Kim Yong Nam Leaves for Cuba
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Leaves for Cuba
   Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday left here to participate in the 14th summit of non-aligned countries slated to be held in Cuba.
 He was seen off at the airport by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the SPA, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and Andrei Karlov, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and Enrique Montoto Cruz, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Cuban embassy here.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Parliamentary Delegation of Indonesia
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Parliamentary Delegation of Indonesia
   Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly Choe Thae Bok met and had a friendly talk with the parliamentary delegation of Indonesia headed by Yoseph Umarhadi, chairman of the Indonesia-DPRK Friendship Parliamentary Group, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday. 
 On hand were Chairman of the DPRK-Indonesia Friendship Parliamentary Group Kim Wan Su, officials concerned and Indonesian Charge d'Affaires ad Interim here Bambang Irawan K.

articles.title: Appeal of Swiss Preparatory Committee Supported
articles.content:
Appeal of Swiss Preparatory Committee Supported
   Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The visiting representative of the Society of Japan-Korea Culture Noboru Kameda issued a statement in Pyongyang on September 11, supporting the appeal of the Swiss preparatory committee to commemorate the Day of the Sun and February 16 in 2007.
 He said his society would inaugurate a preparatory committee for the occasions and sponsor multifarious political and cultural events to stir up an atmosphere of praising the great men in Japan.    
 He declared his society expressed firm solidarity with the Korean people in their just struggle to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the slogan "By our nation itself" and defend socialism, resolutely smashing the moves of the imperialist allied forces to isolate and stifle the DPRK and the Japanese government's reckless maneuvers against the DPRK and the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan.
